cyclone.name: ETA
cyclone.current_location: about 140 miles SSE of Miami, Florida
cyclone.trajectory: Moving northwest through the Florida Straits, expected to cross the Florida Keys tonight, then arc west-northwest into the southeastern Gulf of Mexico and slowly turn north toward the west-central Florida coast late Wed–Thu
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: near or over the Florida Keys (between Ocean Reef and Dry Tortugas)

weather_observation.watch_coast: Florida coast from north of Englewood to Anna Maria Island (includes Manatee County Port)
weather_observation.warning_coast: Florida coast from Brevard/Volusia County line to Englewood under Tropical Storm Warning; Florida Keys Ocean Reef to Dry Tortugas under Hurricane Warning
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Entire south and west-central Florida coastline from the Keys northward through Tampa Bay region
weather_observation.wind: Tropical-storm-force winds (34–50 kt) possible from late Wednesday, with peak cumulative probability of 36%; 50-kt winds unlikely (≤6%).
weather_observation.storm_surge: Minor surge of 1–2 ft possible along the Manatee County coast; higher 2–4 ft values expected farther south (Bonita Beach–Card Sound Bridge).
weather_observation.rainfall: 6–12 inches of rain possible across south-central Florida with locally higher totals, bringing risk of flash and urban flooding in the Tampa Bay/Manatee area.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Isolated tornadoes in outer rainbands; dangerous rip currents and high surf beginning mid-week.
